abstract.p: Roundup of recent advertising account changes (Advertising column) (S)

block.p: * Diamond.com, Sunrise, Fla., part of Odimo.com, a Web site that offers diamonds, watches and other jewelry, to Messner Vetere Berger McNamee Schmetterer/Euro RSCG, New York, part of the Euro RSCG Worldwide unit of Havas Advertising, to handle its first account. Billings were estimated at $35 million. * Halloran Robertson & Associates, San Jose, Calif., was named the first agency to handle two accounts, with combined billings estimated at $30 million. They are eVault, Walnut Creek, Calif., a service that backs up and recovers data on the Web; and PhysicianAccess.com, San Jose, Calif., which automates paperwork for doctors' offices and allows patients access to their medical records online.

* Diamond.com, Sunrise, Fla., part of Odimo.com, a Web site that offers diamonds, watches and other jewelry, to Messner Vetere Berger McNamee Schmetterer/Euro RSCG, New York, part of the Euro RSCG Worldwide unit of Havas Advertising, to handle its first account. Billings were estimated at $35 million. * Halloran Robertson & Associates, San Jose, Calif., was named the first agency to handle two accounts, with combined billings estimated at $30 million. They are eVault, Walnut Creek, Calif., a service that backs up and recovers data on the Web; and PhysicianAccess.com, San Jose, Calif., which automates paperwork for doctors' offices and allows patients access to their medical records online.

* Buy.com, Aliso Viejo, Calif., an online superstore that sells products like electronics, computers and books, to Rubin Postaer & Associates, Santa Monica, Calif., to handle its creative and media account, which had been at Gotham, New York, part of the Interpublic Group of Companies. Billings were estimated at $20 million. Online advertising will continue to be handled in-house. * Champs Sports, Bradenton, Fla., a national chain with retail sporting goods and apparel that is part of the Venator Group, to Towne Silverstein Rotter, New York, to handle its account, which had been at Publicis, New York, part of Publicis S.A. Spending was put at $12 million.
